clinical_study.brief_title: Immunomodulation Analysis of Radiation Therapy in Pediatric Malignant Brain Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Immunomodulation Analysis on Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells of Radiation Therapy in Pediatric Malignant Brain Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the effect of radiotherapy on peripheral blood immune cell composition and function in pediatric malignant brain tumor patients.

primary_outcome.measure: The changes of peripheral blood immune cells
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks (prior and post the radiation therapy )
primary_outcome.description: The flow cytometric analysis of lymphocyte subtypes populations would be performed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks (prior and post the radiation therapy )
secondary_outcome.description: Activation status of peripheral IFN-γ-producing effector CD8+ T cells by Elispot.

secondary_outcome.measure: The changs of inflammatory cytokines and chemokines
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks (prior and post the radiation therapy )
secondary_outcome.description: Human inflammatory cytokines and chemokines will be analyzed by ELISA during radiation therapy. The cytokines and chemokines are IL-2, IL-10, IFN-γ, TNF-α

study_pop.textblock: The brain tumors patients between the ages of 3 year and 18 years who will be received radiation therapy evaluated and determined by their physician

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age from 3 to 18
- To be diagnosed with malignant brain tumors
- To eligible for radiation therapy
- Karnofsky performance status ≥ 70
- No prior radiation exposure
- Informed consent signed for blood sample collection and used for research purpose
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients had received radiotherapy previously.
- Patients who had no histological diagnosis
- Patients who do not wish to participate
- Patients with infections
